channel.title: Opinion on the Pretender?
channel.description:
Since it's been a few hours since the release, and the ability to be played in game. What are your opinions on the newest class introduced in tol?
[poll type=regular public=true] * Not Viable in game ( basically fool 2.0) * Good Idea on a new class but not implemented well * A great new addition to neutrals. [/poll]

item.title: Opinion on the Pretender?
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
RHCube:

Would this be a good buff?

  • Family Matters(Uses: Unlimited) - Determine if your target has royal blood. Reveal your target’s immunities.(Note: Players who are guarded by the king, healed, or defended by a knight will appear to be death immune. Players who are occupied will appear to be redirection immune. Players who are healed will appear to be immune to nightshade and bleeding.)

Yes

Read full topic

item.title: Opinion on the Pretender?
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

Day Ability’s are fine but in practice identical because you would always use them on King.

Usually, but not always. You might want to prevent someone from using a day ability to confirm themselves(especially with Noble, though he needs a rework(for his day abilities at least) anyways). And you might want to use Bribe on someone else if it has already been confirmed to be a pretender game, or if you want to frame a royal.

NuclearBurrito:

For example you could get if target player is occupy or death immune. Or you could get class types. Or bla bla bla you get the point

Would this be a good buff?

  • Family Matters(Uses: Unlimited) - Determine if your target has royal blood. Reveal your target’s immunities.(Note: Players who are guarded by the king, healed, or defended by a knight will appear to be death immune. Players who are occupied will appear to be redirection immune. Players who are healed will appear to be immune to nightshade and bleeding.)

Day Ability’s are fine but in practice identical because you would always use them on King.

I would just make Family matters get additional results on top of Royal or Not.

item.title: Opinion on the Pretender?
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
The main reason why I replaced Family Matters is that it doesn’t really fit with the goal of Pretender. Pretender needs to become king. Sure, killing royals helps eliminate competition, but there usually aren’t a lot of royals in a game.

Read full topic

item.description:
I mean it’s not bad but it feels unnecessary. Parts of it are fine like the RB buff but I feel like buffing Family matters would be more productive

item.title: Opinion on the Pretender?
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
I like the concept of it, but it seems a bit too hard to play as(I haven’t gotten a chance to play it yet though, my opinion might change once I do). Here’s how I would rework it:

Pretender

Neutral special
Passive 1: Determination - Immune to death at night.

Passive 2: Overthrow - During the election for a new king, votes for you count twice. Tied votes will go in your favor(unless another player has an anti-tie passive and is tied with you. Then it will actually be a tie)

Night Ability 1: Intercept(Uses: 3) - Force your first target to target your second. They will not be notified that they were redirected. Bypasses redirection immunity. Can target the king.

Night ability 2: Eavesdrop(Uses: 2)(Note: maid spy and cult spy should also be renamed to this) - Send a maid to receive the contents of all whispers tomorrow.

Day ability 1: Bewilder(Uses: 2)(invoker’s bewilder should also be reworked to this) - Disable your target’s day abilities for the rest of the day. They will not be notified until they attempt to use an ability. Still consumes a use of the ability they were attempting to use.

Day Ability 2: Bribe(Uses: Unlimited?) - Force your target to execute or pardon the accused. They will not be notified until the results are shown. Affects decide fate.

Reasoning:

  • Resolve- Helps it survive

  • Overthrow - Gives a punishment for executing pretenders since pretenders aren’t anti-BD.

  • Intercept - Can change the king and royals’ targets. Can also frame investigatives.

  • Eavesdrop - Gives pretender noble as a fakeclaim

  • Bewilder - discourages day confirmation, helps Pretender claim noble, and is a nerf to prince(prince’s abilities should have counterplay)

  • Bribe - Allows the pretender to frame everyone’s votes, not just the king.

Read full topic

item.title: Opinion on the Pretender?
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
That line of reasoning might be valid. But in practice no one cares

Read full topic

item.title: Opinion on the Pretender?
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
agreed alc is the worse of the claims… but still slightly above “person claiming BD that has done nothing that anyone else can possibly vouch for”, doubly so if they already know there is a pretender (IE if they execute the king that decide fate executed the prince and he flips good king they 100% know there is a pretender).

BD will still take an alc or merc over a pretender… because without guards, you know he’s going to prioritize not upsetting evils.

Read full topic

item.title: Opinion on the Pretender?
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Vandalay:

alch with a confirmed heal or evil kill

Just claim BD and no one is voting the Alch

Read full topic

item.title: Opinion on the Pretender?
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
Sounds fair enough to me, although if the other royals are limited in number that may end up being a touch easy.

I suppose then surviving as the King is the big challenge.

Read full topic

item.title: Opinion on the Pretender?
item.dc:creator: bazingaboy
item.description:
I think the meta will shift to allowing a pretender to usurp the throne for free in certain situations. I don’t know what buffs you could provide to make them confirmable. Maybe a 1 day maidspy? Royals will be less likely to claim to king as they will die if there is a pretender present. Could help kill the whisper meta

I honestly think pretender is the best addition of this patch and it can do a lot. I think waiting to see how people react to it before making drastic changes are needed.

Read full topic

item.title: Opinion on the Pretender?
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
Yeah I’d say some kind of extra trickery in the election. To me it seems like the pretender was planned during the old Royal blood mechanics… where being the last RB was an auto win of the election. Maybe a passive for exactly that… “If no other royal steps up win the election by default”. To me that’s the only thing that really can connect the “kill royal blood” abilities as something that actually goes towards getting elected. as with the change, royal blood is second to semi-confirmability or having informed teammates.

Read full topic

item.title: Opinion on the Pretender?
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
Fair enough - but how do we fix that issue?

I don’t think more kills is the best option. Maybe something that prevents votes for somebody from counting?

Read full topic

item.title: Opinion on the Pretender?
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
maybe I’m missing something, but I don’t see at as much as “convincing others” as “having someone vouch for you”.

Hypothetically if one of the other candidates is

  1. phys that healed someone
  2. observer with logs
  3. butler that someone else can confirm the occupation.
  4. Knight that has CSed someone
  5. alch with a confirmed heal or evil kill
  6. Sheriff/Pali with a recorded catch.

Against any of those what do you claim to get BD to vote for you? scrapping royals from the list as those are the ones the pretender can actually do something about.

all the convincing in the world means nothing next to one person vouching for what you did. Something BD, cult/unseen and even most neutrals have option for. Not so for the pretender. The closest to a good option I see is the pre psycho king NK play

“Hey guys, I’m pretender and I killed the king vote for me because at least you can be sure I’m not Evil king”.

Read full topic
